ygData.messageBody:
To clarify, this was a case where the cleric and druid coming in made
absolutely no effort to do anything but make it into a free for all. The druid
asked if there was an order, and I said yes, myself and the cleric, and
another wizard that was present. The druid, instead of asking if she could
have a turn in the rotation, stated that it would be a "FFA" (free for all).
Why would a L28 druid barge into the warlord room in that manner, unless they
were confident they could win every kill? As I said, after my demonstration,
she apologized for how she acted and said she was not aware a bard could do
such a thing.

Side note, I also have a lower level druid I play, and it is extremely easy to
do enough damage to get credit for a kill. However, having played through 26
levels as a class where I was often having my kill stolen, I instead help
others and only steal kills off people doing it to others, whether they be
bards, warriors, or lower level players. I'm sort of a Robin Hood of EQ - help
those in need, and antagonize the jerks to no end.

Ariell Thunderwolf, Karana


> No, I don't see anything wrong with this picture. There was a druid AND a
> cleric. A cleric CAN use a BI crown (uh oh! acronym!). Both of the people
> were appropriate level.
